fields.description:
Security policy should be configurable on the...
- Create ELB Wizard
- ELB Detail Page (General tab)

The security policy can be one of the following...
- Configure a security policy based on a predefined policy
- Configure a custom security policy, with configurable protocols (e.g. TLSv1) and ciphers.

comments.body: [~spark]: What is the API call to list the security policies available to attach to an ELB?
[~kgill] It's describe-load-balancer-policies. There the policy has the policy type: SSLNegotiationPolicyType.

[~spark]: describe-load-balancer-policies lists the policies currently associated with an ELB.  What I'm looking for is the list of security policies *available* to associate with an ELB. Or should there be only one choice available (e.g. ELBSecurityPolicy-2015-05), looking at EUCA-10985?
[~kgill] Can you sniff packets using tcpdump (tcpdump -i em1 -l -A -s8192 'tcp port 8773') ? I'm thinking that maybe service returns the list but boto filters them with OtherPolicy type.

[~spark]: I pushed a workaround for Boto's lack of DescribeLoadBalancerPolicies API method in https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/commit/b5095f62
I had to resort to parsing the XML response, but it seems to work for now.

hi [~kgill], in this ticket can you plz fix a display issue in the listener table (create ELB and detail page)?

The SECURITY <th> should be centered above POLICY and CERTS please. It's right justified now.  Wanted to move GUI-1486 through so figured you could take care of that here instead. 

Thank you!!

[~jloza]: The SECURITY table header is centered (see attached screenshot), but it doesn't appear centered due to the way the table cells are rendered, especially when no HTTPS listener is set.  Should we change it to left-aligned?
[~kgill], maybe what we need to do is make the two <th> below each upper one equal width (we have loads of space to play with in this table), so that all the headers are nicely aligned?

[~jloza]: Setting a fixed width for the second row table headers would improve the appearance when there are no HTTPS listeners, but it would probably look terrible when there are HTTPS listeners, so it's probably better to allow the contents of the table cells determine the column widths.
hi [~kgill] perhaps flexboxing might help center that guy a bit more? IDK, there must be **something** we can do...

btw, for making flex simpler, I introduced some re-usable classes in GUI-1637, but slightly revised that in GUI-1587, which I found more flexible (no pun intended).
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/blob/GUI-1587/eucaconsole/static/sass/eucaconsole.scss#L473-L481

[~kgill] Not sure if I understand the problem but the way detach a policy from the listener is to call SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener with empty policy list (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/reference/elb/set-load-balancer-policies-of-listener.html).

[~spark]: Thank you Sang-Min.  I'm now using the empty-policy approach to detach policies from a listener, but we still need code to prevent stale policies from displaying as the active policy for an ELB, which I've implemented in GUI-1621.

[~jloza]: I have a workaround that may allow us to keep the "Change" link next to the security policy in the listeners table.  Will explain more next week.

Ready for UX review.  PR is at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1436 when ready for code review (although PR 1429 for GUI-1486 should be merged before PR 1436 since GUI-1621 was branched off GUI-1486).

Great start, [~kgill].

Table:
* top th, alignment is not consistent (between create wizard and detail page) and still doesn't look right. This is for readability, so it's important to get it right. If you keep the vertical rules between like you have on the detail page, we could maybe try left justifying all the top th and see how that looks. Let's screen share when you are ready to fiddle with this so we can get something that I can approve without having to send ticket back and forth please. We may need to style them differently. 
* certificates help bubble icon is wrapping on create wizard
* - icon in table says "Remove rule" should say "Remove listener"
 

On dialog:

* Title needs to be sentence case
* Under custom button, protocols and ciphers labels should be indicating required
* Ciphers chosen probably needs search turned on please, there's a lot there, and we don't display them (purposefully) in alpha order, so search will probably be beneficial.
* Checkbox label should be sentence case

[~jloza]: My updates are noted inline in brackets...

Table:
* top th, alignment is not consistent (between create wizard and detail page) and still doesn't look right. This is for readability, so it's important to get it right. If you keep the vertical rules between like you have on the detail page, we could maybe try left justifying all the top th and see how that looks. Let's screen share when you are ready to fiddle with this so we can get something that I can approve without having to send ticket back and forth please. We may need to style them differently. [FIXED: By left-aligning top row headers and adding vertical rules.  Let me know if this still isn't good enough and we can screen share to try another approach]
* certificates help bubble icon is wrapping on create wizard [FIXED]
* - icon in table says "Remove rule" should say "Remove listener" [FIXED]

On dialog:

* Title needs to be sentence case [FIXED]
* Under custom button, protocols and ciphers labels should be indicating required [FIXED]
* Ciphers chosen probably needs search turned on please, there's a lot there, and we don't display them (purposefully) in alpha order, so search will probably be beneficial. [Search is/was enabled for the chosen widget.  Could you try again (perhaps clear your browser cache?) and let me know if it doesn't work?]
* Checkbox label should be sentence case [FIXED]

Found out after investigating that the search issue is an issue with the chosen widget, and not the branch. 

UX review passed, ready for code review.
[~dkavanagh]: Heads up to review/merge PR 1429 for GUI-1486 before reviewing PR 1436 since GUI-1621 was branched off GUI-1486
I notice that when I create a custom policy, then bring up the dialog to change it, I'm not presented with the same options I selected, so I have no idea what they were (except that I remembered).
done!
